message: Actually just poked @ericflo about this. I think we'll get another one going soon
We'll definitely need to figure out speaker(s) and a venue. I was going to harass @andymccurdy and see if Whiskey media wanted to host again
Awesome! Been thinking up some good topics. Anything I can help with let me know.
I'll let him speak for himself but he seemed pretty open to the idea of hosting :)
In fact I think he replied to you on twitter @zeeg
How about the price of conference places for speakers? ;-)
(Also depending on the numbers Disqus may be able to host one later this year as well)
So now we need a topic/speakers :)
Ya :)
how many people have showed up to django sf events in the past?

yea, sure, if whiskey is up for it this time, that works. We probably don't have room to fit that many in the office comfortably, but we found a space right near our office that can hold up to about 100
we should be able to swing pizza and beer, but no guarantees about paying speakers, though ;)
because I just joined dotcloud, and would love to host :)

I would love to get this going either monthly or every other month just to maintain the activity (assuming we have enough content). Last one I went to I think there were around 40-50 people, but I don't quite remember. If you guys can fit that many @gg maybe after this next one, you guys can take the spot?
@zeeg where are you guys located?
p.s. this is why I'm super excited to have moved to SF: I'm dreaming of a mini-pycon every month :)
We're down in SOMA at 3rd and Folsom
err, 2nd and Howard :)
@zeeg Why do you always get that address wrong? You did that with me as well when I was in SF.
I live at 3rd and Folsom, which is like two blocks away ><
heh, close enough :) We used to be just south of there, but just moved up to the south end of the financial district (Sansome & Bush). So, still nearby.
I'm always happy to rant about Chef and config management in general :-)
@coderanger Have you been to the ArchCamp unconference/lightning talk stuff? I kind of like that style, it ends up being a ton of discussion with smart people
How about ecommerce, there are now a bunch of new products. Or monitoring, there's Shinken and New Relic has a Python beta.
@mihasya I know :/
@sasha monitoring was a great addition -- got any speakers in mind? yourself maybe? need to fill 1 or 2 more 10-15m slots :)
By the way, added the meetup. July 6th at Wsiskey Media http://www.meetup.com/The-San-Francisco-Django-Meetup-Group/events/19789411/
By the way, being that I'm a complete newb to this stuff, if anyones interested in helping organize things let me know
@zeeg lol I'd volunteer to do a quick monitoring talk but I didn't get on new relic's beta nor did I get Shinken working when I tried last. I'll try again though.
Wait that meetup we hosted at SG was in november?!! fucking time flies..
